name: skeletons / zombies
description: Crushing 1 weapons attack Skeletons at +1. Arrows are at -1 against both skeletons and zombies. Skeletons and zombies never test morale.

name: goblins
reaction: (d6): 1 flee if outnumbered, 2-3 bribe (5 gp per goblin), 4–6 fight.
description: Goblins have a 1 in 6 chance of gaining surprise, thus acting before the party. If they do act before the party, roll d6 on their reactions table.

name: hobgoblins
reaction: (d6): 1 flee if outnumbered, 2–3 bribe (10 gp per hobgoblin), 4–5 fight, 6 fight to the death.

name: orcs
reaction: (d6): 1-2 bribe (10 gp per orc), 3–5 fight, 6 fight to the death.
description: Orcs are afraid of magic and must test morale each time one or more is killed by a spell. If a spell caused their number to drop below 50%, they will test morale at -1. They never have magic items in their treasure: treat any rolled magic as d6 x d6 gold pieces instead.

name: trolls
reaction: (d6): 1–2 fight, 3–6 fight to the death. If a dwarf is present in the party, trolls will automatically fight to the death.
description: Trolls regenerate, unless killed by a spell, or unless a character uses one attack to chop an already killed troll to bits. If this does not happen, roll a die or every killed troll on its next turn. On a 5 or 6, the troll will come back to life and continue to fight.

name: Fungi Folk
reaction: (d6): 1-2 ask for bribe (d6 gp per fungus), 3–6 fight.
description: Any character taking damage from the fungi folk must 6 save versus level 3 poison or lose 1 life. Halflings add their level on this save.
